elements.title: Gladys Ingle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Gladys Ingle was a wing walker who successfully moved from the wing of one airplane to the wing of another in mid-air (example pictured) more than 300 times?

elements.title: an Iowa TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Fox television network successfully moved to strip an Iowa TV station of its affiliation?

elements.title: Nicholas Dheilly (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Canadian football player Nicholas Dheilly tied his team's single-game sack record in his debut?

elements.title: Octavius V. Catto Memorial (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Octavius V. Catto Memorial, unveiled in 2017, contains the first statue on Philadelphia public property of a specific African American?

elements.title: Heba Saadia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Heba Saadia, the first Palestinian referee at a World Cup, only took up the profession when she noticed there were no women among a group of referees she saw training?

elements.title: Jon Stewart went on CNN's Crossfire (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that three months after Jon Stewart went on CNN's Crossfire and told the hosts that their show was "hurting America", CNN cancelled it and fired co-host Tucker Carlson?

elements.title: Poniatowski gems (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Poniatowski gems, 19th-century forgeries of ancient engraved gems, have themselves been copied by other forgers?

elements.title: Wrinkle Five Star (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Wrinkle Five Star set an unratified 1 km (0.62 mi) world record of 18 minutes 8 seconds while running in custom shoes?
